it.polimi.deib.se2019.sanp4.adrenaline.controller

Class PaymentHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.deib.se2019.sanp4.adrenaline.controller.PaymentHandler

  • public class PaymentHandler
extends Object
    Offers a service to other classes of the controller to handle the payment of a certain cost expressed in AmmoCubeCost from a given player. If the user has enough ammo cubes to pay, the payment is automatic. If the user has powerups, the handler will only ask the user to select a powerup if he has more powerups than the ones needed to cover the cost, otherwise the selection is made automatically.
    Author:
    Alessandro Fulgini

    • Method Detail

      • convertPowerupToAmmoCube

        public void convertPowerupToAmmoCube(Player player,
                                     PowerupCard card)
        Converts a powerup card that the player has in his hands to an ammo cube, which will be given to the player, while the card is discarded in the deck
        Parameters:
        player - The player who holds the powerup card, not null
        card - The powerup card that has to be converted, not null
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the powerup does not belong to the player

      • payAmmoCost

        public boolean payAmmoCost(PersistentView view,
                           Map<AmmoCubeCost,Integer> cost,
                           boolean removeAmmoFromPlayer)
                    throws InterruptedException
        Ask the player to pay an ammo cost with his resources. The payment method is implemented as follows:
        1. If the player has enough ammo, the payment is automatic
        2. If the player does not have enough ammo, the algorithm tries to use powerups
        3. If there is only a powerup (or identical powerups) to pay a specific color, the payment is automatic, if there are different powerups the user will be prompted

        If the payment is successful, this method returns true, if it failed for lack of resources it returns false and the user's resources (ammo cubes and powerups) are left untouched.

        If the flag removeAmmoFromPlayer is set this method will also remove the ammo and the powerups used to pay from the player's resources. If it is not set, then it will only convert the powerups used to cover the cost to AmmoCube

        Parameters:
        view - The view of the player who has to pay the cost, not null
        cost - A map containing the number of cubes to pay for each color, not null and with no negative values
        removeAmmoFromPlayer - If true the cubes and powerups used to pay will be removed from the player
        Returns:
        Whether the user has been able to pay the cost or not
        Throws:
        CancellationException - If a request to the user gets cancelled, the user's resources remain untouched
        InterruptedException - If the thread gets interrupted while waiting
